title: (x) Luma brush script - Kid TYPEPaint {Mike Y}
content:
Is this a font? All a’s match and other letters pretty much do too, although this doesn’t look like a font.  
Please help! Thank you

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Luma.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225848/http:/typophile.com/files/Luma.jpg) | 73.08 KB |

 [‹ Dentyne Ice gum logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225848/http:/typophile.com/node/15433 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Your Party Is Our Business - Artistik {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225848/http:/typophile.com/node/15461 "Go to next forum topic")
author: misalion

comments.content: This is 5 m work with Illustrator.
the a’s are all the same, as are the r’s and the t’s... so it _might_ be a font...

Same style, but not quite.  
 [Linotype Seven™ Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225848/http:/www.linotype.com/10120/linotypesevenregular-font.html)
Ah. One of the faces I deleted from the CD I was given for joining FontZone. That explains it!
how do you delete something from a CD???
Tiff is a Level Ten Hyper-Moderator, Paul. She can do stuff you can’t even begin to fathom. Never underestimate that woman’s prowess!

oh YOU guys! stop. :^D i simply meant that when i received a linotype CD for signing up for Fontzone I deleted many of the typefaces which i had installed on my machine because they weren’t so useful.

Speaking of Fontzone, I got a free subscription (thanks to a SoTA membership bonus) back in December, but have yet to use it at all (and it expires this December). Should I? I ask because I haven’t even been making time for worthy old standbys like Typographica lately.

hhp

To get back to the font ID request - this is a font called “KidTYPE Paint” from DS Design. You can see a sample of it in the [Script Font ID Guide, Part 12, page 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225848/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script12Pg2.html).

This font used to be part of the Agfa Creative Alliance collection.

- Mike Yanega

Here is a [Test Drive from MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225848/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/kid/typepaint/testdrive.html?s=Luma+restaurant&p=36) if you need further evidence that this is the font. Looks like Monotype still carries the font family.  
- Mike Yanega
